Key Match Events: Donte DiVincenzo made one of two free throws with 12.1 seconds left, giving the Timberwolves a 112-110 lead.
Rudy Gobert had 17 points and 15 rebounds for the Timberwolves, won won their third straight.
Randle made a driving layup against Wembanyama that was initially whistled for an offensive foul, and the basket was allowed to stand after a challenge by Timberwolves coach Chris Finch.
Post-Match Reflections: Anthony Edwards was fined $100,000 for continued use of profanity in postgame media comments, and was held to 14 points, 11 below his season average.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves survived a brutal shooting night from 3-point range, making just 11 of 44 attempts from beyond the arc.
In the first quarter, the Timberwolves made just 1 of 11 3-point attempts but went 9 for 9 inside the arc.
Others: The Spurs host the Clippers, and the Timberwolves visit Oklahoma City on Tuesday.
